name: lecherously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows a strong sexual interest in someone that is not wanted by that person: He swept his hat from his head, scratched his balding pate, and winked lecherously at her. The camera lecherously eyes the female star's rear end.
More examplesFewer examplesRubbing his fake potbelly, one actor pretended to lean lecherously against a graceful young woman riding on the bus.The images showed women in bikinis holding champagne glasses and men in suits grinning lecherously at them. Exotic dancers gyrated, watched lecherously by older, affluent-looking men.
